clinical_study.official_title: Patients With Mortality After Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatography

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, the investigators aimed to overview patients with specific and non-specific complications who admitted to intensive care unit following endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography and had fatal course in the facility

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators retrospectively reviewed patients who underwent elective or emergent endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography at semi-prone position under pharyngeal anesthesia (lidocaine spray) with routine monitoring (including electrocardiography, non-invasive blood pressure, peripheral capillary oxygen saturation) and standard sedation protocol (midazolam 0.02 mgkg-1; fentanyl, 1 mgkg-1; propofol 1 mgkg-1) between 2011 and 2016 after approval of local ethics committee of Umraniye Training Hospital.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography Related complications
primary_outcome.description: We retrospectively reviewed patients who underwent elective or emergent endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography at semi-prone position under pharyngeal anesthesia (lidocaine spray) with routine monitoring (including electrocardiography, non-invasive blood pressure, peripheral capillary oxygen saturation) and standard sedation protocol

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of anaesthesia related mortality of the endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatographyprocedure under sedation
primary_outcome.description: We identified patients who developed complications during procedure and admitted to intensive care unit (ICU).

secondary_outcome.measure: Value of Acute Physiology and Chronic Health Evaluation (APACHE II) score for predicting mortality
Value of Charlson comorbidity index (CCI) score for predicting mortality

intervention.description: patients may have anesthesia related complications during procedure

study_pop.textblock: We retrospectively reviewed 1471 patients who underwent elective or emergent ERCP at semi-prone position under pharyngeal anesthesia (lidocaine spray) with routine monitoring (including electrocardiography, non-invasive blood pressure, peripheral capillary oxygen saturation) and standard sedation protocol

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who underwent elective or emergent ERCP at semi-prone position with routine monitoring and standard sedation protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who discharged to ward after treatment and follow-up in ICU
